issue.title: Add support for bare-named property methods

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
[Immutables](https://immutables.github.io/) is a wonderful code generator for value types.  It has support for `Optional` types, but creates the wrapper object from a nullable field under the hood.

Immutables also encourages bare-named property methods as opposed to bean-named.  (i.e. `property()` rather than `getProperty()`)

`assertj` provides great support for extracting values from types.

In the case of mixing `immutables`, `assertj`, and optional types, some confusing behavior emerges!  For a property `OptionalInt property()`, the implementation will store `Integer property;` and implement `property() { return OptionalInt.ofNullable(property); }`.  `assertj` does not consider bare-named property methods for extraction, and instead cracks open the field.  But the field is a different type than the programmer expected!  This leads to confusing assertion mismatches, "expected OptionalInt(42) got 42 instead" and the like, and it's not at all immediately clear why.

The simplest fix is to add property support for methods that match the property name exactly, without the `get` or `is` prefix.

I authored this code and release it under Apache 2.0 to the project.

body:
Thanks for creating this @joel-costigliola. Just my 2 cents about this.

Not everything needs to have an SPI. Maybe for some of the properties a single `SettingsProvider` or whatever the name would be enough as then people can override that and provide their own changes. In any case I think everything you mentioned into this fits into a single SPI (in my opinion)
This issue should likely be split, one important configuration to support is related to https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/pull/1360#issuecomment-470299508

issue.title: Collection print does not work properly when collection extends AtomicInteger

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

body:

```

- representation .................................. = BinaryRepresentation

- additionnal date formats ........................ = [yyyy_MM_dd, yyyy|MM|dd]
- maxLengthForSingleLineDescription ............... = 81

- removeAssertJRelatedElementsFromStackTraceEnabled = false

Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Skipped: 1, Time elapsed: 0.305 sec
```

issue.title: Document AssertJ configuration
issue.body:
With https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/issues/1361 AssertJ provides a way to register a configuration to globally change AssertJ behavior.

- [x] document configuration registration like in https://assertj.github.io/doc/#assertj-core-custom-representation-default-global-scope
- [x] deprecate representation registration

issue.title: Registering a Representation through a file named 'org.assertj.core.presentation.Representation' in the META-INF/services directory is deprecated

repository.name: JsonUnit
repository.description: Compare JSON in your Unit Tests

issue.body:
Latest assertj (3.13.2) shows this on startup:
```
Although it still works, registering a Representation through a file named 'org.assertj.core.presentation.Representation' in the META-INF/services directory is deprecated.
The proper way of providing a Representation is to register a Configuration as described in the documentation (a Configuration allowing to provide a Representation and other AssertJ configuration elements)
```
It is because of this file https://github.com/lukas-krecan/JsonUnit/blob/08a361daeebbe5dcc50f58cdf426649528cc4ea6/json-unit-assertj/src/main/resources/META-INF/services/org.assertj.core.presentation.Representation

Such error message had been added in v3.13.0 https://github.com/joel-costigliola/assertj-core/issues/1361
